servinfo.title: Rear Suspension Frame Removal and Installation

attention1.ptxt: When removing rear suspension frame, be sure to apply some supporting equipment (such as mission jack) under it at well-balanced position in the center section so as to prevent from its drop.

s1.ptxt: Hoist vehicle and remove rear wheels.
Remove muffler and exhaust center pipe referring to Exhaust System Components:For Petrol Engine Model .
To facilitate reinstallation, put match marks (1) on rear propeller shaft flange and differential flange. Disconnect rear propeller shaft form differential.
Remove rear wheel hub assembly referring to Rear Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove control rod referring to Control Rod Removal and Installation .
Remove trailing rod referring to Trailing Rod Removal and Installation .
Remove lower arm referring to Lower Arm Removal and Installation .
Remove rear drive shaft referring to Rear Drive Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation:Rear .
Remove rear suspension knuckle referring to Rear Suspension Knuckle Removal and Installation .
Remove upper arm referring to Upper Arm Removal and Installation .
Remove parking cable clamp bolt (1) and parking cable clamp (2).
Remove rear wheel speed sensor clamp bolt (1) and speed sensor harness clamp (2) (if equipped).
Disconnect rear height sensor connector (3) and rear height sensor harness clamp (4) (if equipped) for left side.
Support rear suspension frame with rear differential by using mission jack (1).
Remove rear suspension frame mount bolts (1) and washer (2) and then lower mission jack and remove rear suspension frame (3) with rear differential and rear suspension frame stopper (4).
Dismounting rear differential from rear suspension frame referring to Rear Differential Unit Components:Rear .
Remove rear suspension frame stiffener and dynamic damper from rear suspension frame, if necessary.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Rear Suspension Frame, Bushing and Pad Check

s1.ptxt: Install rear suspension frame stiffeners (1) and dynamic damper (2) to rear suspension frame (3), if removed.
Remounting rear differential to rear suspension fame referring to Rear Differential Unit Components:Rear .
Support rear suspension frame with rear differential by using mission jack, and jack up it.
Install rear suspension frame (3) to vehicle body and tighten rear suspension frame mount bolts (1) with washer (2) to specified torque.

attention2.ptxt: If suspension frame mount bolts are reused, apply engine oil to thread, bearing and trunk surface.

s1.ptxt: Connect rear height sensor connector (3) and rear height sensor harness clamp (4) (if equipped) for left side.
Tighten wheel sensor bolt (1) to specified torque and then connect wheel speed sensor harness clamp (2).
Tighten parking cable clamp bolt (1) to specified torque and then connect parking cable clamp (2).
Install upper arm referring to Upper Arm Removal and Installation .
Install rear suspension knuckle referring to Rear Suspension Knuckle Removal and Installation .
Install rear drive shaft referring to Rear Drive Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation:Rear .
Install lower arm referring to Lower Arm Removal and Installation .
Install trailing rod referring to Trailing Rod Removal and Installation .
Install control rod referring to Control Rod Removal and Installation Control Rod Removal and Installation .
Install rear wheel hub assembly referring to Rear Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation .
Connect rear propeller shaft to differential aligning match marks on flanges. Tighten bolts and nuts to specified torque. Refer to Propeller Shaft Removal and Installation .
Install exhaust muffler and exhaust center pipe referring to Exhaust System Components:For Petrol Engine Model .
Fill reservoir with brake fluid and bleed brake system. Refer to Air Bleeding of Brake System .

Upon completion of all jobs, depress brake pedal with about 30 kg (66 lbs) load a few times so as to obtain proper drum-to-shoe clearance. Adjust parking brake cable. Refer to Parking Brake Check and Adjustment .
Install rear wheels.
Check to ensure that brake drum is free from dragging and proper braking is obtained.
Lower hoist and tighten rear wheel bolts to specified torque.
Bounce vehicle up and down to stabilize suspension.
Tighten each bolts and nuts to specified torque with vehicle weight on suspension.

attention3.ptxt: It is the most desirable to have vehicle off hoist and in non-loaded condition when tightening them.

s1.ptxt: Perform brake test (foot brake and parking brake).
Check each installed part for fluid leakage.
Check rear toe and camber and adjust it if necessary. For check and adjustment procedures, refer to Rear Wheel Alignment Inspection and Adjustment .
Adjust auto leveling headlight system, referring to Initialization of Auto Leveling Headlight System .
